completion_window.description: The time frame within which the batch should be processed. Durations from `24h` to `7d` are supported.

endpoint.description: The endpoint to be used for all requests in the batch. Currently `/v1/chat/completions` is supported.

input_file_id.description:
The ID of an uploaded file that contains requests for the new batch.

See [upload file](/docs/api-reference#files-upload) for how to upload a file.

Your input file must be formatted as a [JSONL file](/docs/batch), and must be uploaded with the purpose `batch`. The file can be up to 100 MB in size.

metadata.description: Optional custom metadata for the batch.

cancelled_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch was cancelled.

cancelling_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch started cancelling.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch was completed.

completion_window.description: The time frame within which the batch should be processed.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch was created.

endpoint.description: The API endpoint used by the batch.

error_file_id.description: The ID of the file containing the outputs of requests with errors.

code.description: An error code identifying the error type.

line.description: The line number of the input file where the error occurred, if applicable.

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

param.description: The name of the parameter that caused the error, if applicable.

object.description: The object type, which is always `list`.

expired_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch expired.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch will expire.

failed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch failed.

finalizing_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch started finalizing.

in_progress_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the batch started processing.

input_file_id.description: The ID of the input file for the batch.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

object.description: The object type, which is always `batch`.

output_file_id.description: The ID of the file containing the outputs of successfully executed requests.

request_counts.description: The request counts for different statuses within the batch.

completed.description: Number of requests that have been completed successfully.

failed.description: Number of requests that have failed.

total.description: Total number of requests in the batch.

status.description: The current status of the batch.

summary: Creates and executes a batch from an uploaded file of requests. [Learn more](/docs/batch).
